classes.title: ASTR61.
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: The Copernican Revolution.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This seminar explores the 2,000-year effort to understand the motion of the sun, moon, stars, and five visible planets. Earth-centered cosmos gives way to the conclusion that earth is just another body in space. Cultural changes accompany this revolution in thinking.Gen Ed: PL, NA, WB.Grading status: Letter gradeSame as: PHYS�61.

classes.title: ASTR63.
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Catastrophe and Chaos: Unpredictable Physics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This seminar explores the 2,000-year effort to understand the motion of the sun, moon, stars, and five visible planets. Earth-centered cosmos gives way to the conclusion that earth is just another body in space. Cultural changes accompany this revolution in thinking.Gen Ed: PL, NA, WB.Grading status: Letter gradeSame as: PHYS�61.

classes.title: ASTR63.
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Catastrophe and Chaos: Unpredictable Physics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Physics is often seen as the most precise and deterministic of sciences. Determinism can break down, however. This seminar explores the rich and diverse areas of modern physics in which "unpredictability" is the norm. Honors version availableGen Ed: PL, QI.Grading status: Letter gradeSame as: PHYS�63.

classes.title: ASTR89.
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Special Topics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Physics is often seen as the most precise and deterministic of sciences. Determinism can break down, however. This seminar explores the rich and diverse areas of modern physics in which "unpredictability" is the norm. Honors version availableGen Ed: PL, QI.Grading status: Letter gradeSame as: PHYS�63.

classes.title: ASTR89.
classes.subtitle: First-Year Seminar: Special Topics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Special topics course content will vary each semester.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR101
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astronomy:  The Solar System.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Special topics course content will vary each semester.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 6 total credits. 2 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR101
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astronomy:  The Solar System.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Celestial motions of the earth, sun, moon, and planets; nature of light; ground and space-based telescopes; comparative planetology; the earth and the moon; terrestrial and gas planets and their moons; dwarf planets, asteroids, and comets; planetary system formation; extrasolar planets; the search for extraterrestrial intelligence (SETI). Honors version availableGen Ed: PX.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR101
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astronomy Laboratory: Our Place in Space.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Celestial motions of the earth, sun, moon, and planets; nature of light; ground and space-based telescopes; comparative planetology; the earth and the moon; terrestrial and gas planets and their moons; dwarf planets, asteroids, and comets; planetary system formation; extrasolar planets; the search for extraterrestrial intelligence (SETI). Honors version availableGen Ed: PX.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR101
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astronomy Laboratory: Our Place in Space.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Observing with robotic telescopes in Chile, Australia, and around the world: planets, dwarf planets, moons, asteroids, binary and variable stars, supernovae, star-forming regions, star clusters, and galaxies; the seasons, the Galilean revolution; the cosmic distance ladder; the Great Debate; dark matter; Hubble's Law; dark energy.Requisites: Pre- or corequisite, ASTR�101.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR102
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astronomy:  Stars, Galaxies & Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Observing with robotic telescopes in Chile, Australia, and around the world: planets, dwarf planets, moons, asteroids, binary and variable stars, supernovae, star-forming regions, star clusters, and galaxies; the seasons, the Galilean revolution; the cosmic distance ladder; the Great Debate; dark matter; Hubble's Law; dark energy.Requisites: Pre- or corequisite, ASTR�101.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR102
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astronomy:  Stars, Galaxies & Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The sun, stellar observables, star birth, evolution, and death, novae and supernovae, white dwarfs, neutron stars, black holes, the Milky Way galaxy, normal galaxies, active galaxies and quasars, dark matter, dark energy, cosmology, early universe. Honors version availableRequisites: Prerequisite, ASTR�101, or pre- or co-requisite, PHYS�117 or 119; Permission of the instructor for students lacking the pre- or co-requisites.Gen Ed: PL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR105
classes.subtitle: Time, Tides, and the Measurement of the Cosmos.  3 Credits.
classes.description: The sun, stellar observables, star birth, evolution, and death, novae and supernovae, white dwarfs, neutron stars, black holes, the Milky Way galaxy, normal galaxies, active galaxies and quasars, dark matter, dark energy, cosmology, early universe. Honors version availableRequisites: Prerequisite, ASTR�101, or pre- or co-requisite, PHYS�117 or 119; Permission of the instructor for students lacking the pre- or co-requisites.Gen Ed: PL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR105
classes.subtitle: Time, Tides, and the Measurement of the Cosmos.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course is focused on medieval foundations of modern cosmology and is designed to take advantage of the opportunities available for enriched learning in England. The course is problem-based, e.g. How did people reckon calendars, time, and tides, both for navigation and daily life, before clocks and the printed word? Honors version availableGen Ed: PL, WB.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR111
classes.subtitle: Educational Research in Radio Astronomy.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This course is focused on medieval foundations of modern cosmology and is designed to take advantage of the opportunities available for enriched learning in England. The course is problem-based, e.g. How did people reckon calendars, time, and tides, both for navigation and daily life, before clocks and the printed word? Honors version availableGen Ed: PL, WB.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR111
classes.subtitle: Educational Research in Radio Astronomy.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. One-week field experience at the National Radio Astronomy Observatory in Green Bank, WV, for experiential education (EE) credit. Observing with radio telescopes and antennae: supernova remnants, star-forming regions, normal and active galaxies, quasars, solar system objects (sun, moon, Jupiter), radio spectroscopy.Gen Ed: EE- Field Work.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR202
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astrophysics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. One-week field experience at the National Radio Astronomy Observatory in Green Bank, WV, for experiential education (EE) credit. Observing with radio telescopes and antennae: supernova remnants, star-forming regions, normal and active galaxies, quasars, solar system objects (sun, moon, Jupiter), radio spectroscopy.Gen Ed: EE- Field Work.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR202
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Astrophysics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This introductory astrophysics course will focus on the use of classical mechanics, gravitational physics, and the physics of radiation to interpret and explain astronomical observations. Course covers stellar structure, stellar formation and evolution, galaxies, and cosmology with an emphasis on quantitative problem solving.Requisites: Pre- or corequisite, PHYS�119.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR205
classes.subtitle: The Medieval Foundations of Modern Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This introductory astrophysics course will focus on the use of classical mechanics, gravitational physics, and the physics of radiation to interpret and explain astronomical observations. Course covers stellar structure, stellar formation and evolution, galaxies, and cosmology with an emphasis on quantitative problem solving.Requisites: Pre- or corequisite, PHYS�119.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR205
classes.subtitle: The Medieval Foundations of Modern Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course will examine science as it emerged and developed in the West starting in the 13th century. We will use example problems from cosmology that are relevant today.Gen Ed: PL, WB.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR301
classes.subtitle: Stars, Galaxies, and Cosmology.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This course will examine science as it emerged and developed in the West starting in the 13th century. We will use example problems from cosmology that are relevant today.Gen Ed: PL, WB.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR301
classes.subtitle: Stars, Galaxies, and Cosmology.  1 Credit.
classes.description: Pre- or  Permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisites. Stellar observables; galaxies; novae; cosmology; the early universe. This one-credit course can be taken with ASTR�102 for students who wish to major or minor in astrophysics.Requisites: co-requisites, ASTR�102, and PHYS�117 or 119;Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR390
classes.subtitle: Research and Special Topics for Juniors and Seniors.  1-12 Credits.
classes.description: Pre- or  Permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisites. Stellar observables; galaxies; novae; cosmology; the early universe. This one-credit course can be taken with ASTR�102 for students who wish to major or minor in astrophysics.Requisites: co-requisites, ASTR�102, and PHYS�117 or 119;Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR390
classes.subtitle: Research and Special Topics for Juniors and Seniors.  1-12 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. To be taken by honors candidates and other qualified juniors and seniors.Gen Ed: QI.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 12 total credits. 4 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR501
classes.subtitle: Astrophysics I (Stellar Astrophysics).  3 Credits.
classes.description: Permission of the instructor. To be taken by honors candidates and other qualified juniors and seniors.Gen Ed: QI.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. 12 total credits. 4 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR501
classes.subtitle: Astrophysics I (Stellar Astrophysics).  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to the study of stellar structure and evolution. Topics covered include observational techniques, stellar structure and energy transport, nuclear energy sources, evolution off the main-sequence, and supernovae.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, MATH�383, and PHYS�331; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisites.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR502
classes.subtitle: Astrophysics II (Modern Research in Astrophysics).  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to the study of stellar structure and evolution. Topics covered include observational techniques, stellar structure and energy transport, nuclear energy sources, evolution off the main-sequence, and supernovae.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, MATH�383, and PHYS�331; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisites.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR502
classes.subtitle: Astrophysics II (Modern Research in Astrophysics).  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern research in astrophysics based on scientific journal articles addressing a current topic of interest in galactic or extragalactic astrophysics, including training in computer modeling and statistical analysis, culminating in the completion of a research project.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, and MATH�383; pre- or corequisite, PHYS�331.Gen Ed: EE- Mentored Research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR503
classes.subtitle: Structure and Evolution of Galaxies.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern research in astrophysics based on scientific journal articles addressing a current topic of interest in galactic or extragalactic astrophysics, including training in computer modeling and statistical analysis, culminating in the completion of a research project.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, and MATH�383; pre- or corequisite, PHYS�331.Gen Ed: EE- Mentored Research.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR503
classes.subtitle: Structure and Evolution of Galaxies.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Overview of the structure and evolution of galaxies, with emphasis on learning and applying modern research methods such as scientific literature review and computational astrostatistics. Includes galaxy morphology and dynamics, star formation, active galactic nuclei, galaxy interactions, large-scale clustering, environment-dependent physical processes, and the evolution of the galaxy population over cosmic time.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, MATH�383, and PHYS�331.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR504
classes.subtitle: Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Overview of the structure and evolution of galaxies, with emphasis on learning and applying modern research methods such as scientific literature review and computational astrostatistics. Includes galaxy morphology and dynamics, star formation, active galactic nuclei, galaxy interactions, large-scale clustering, environment-dependent physical processes, and the evolution of the galaxy population over cosmic time.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, MATH�383, and PHYS�331.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR504
classes.subtitle: Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern cosmology: the study of the contents and evolution of the universe. Covers expanding spacetime, the thermal history of the early universe, including nucleosynthesis and the cosmic microwave background, the inflationary model for the origins of cosmic structure, and the growth of that structure through time.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, and PHYS�401; pre- or corequisite, PHYS�421.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR505
classes.subtitle: Physics of Interstellar Gas.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern cosmology: the study of the contents and evolution of the universe. Covers expanding spacetime, the thermal history of the early universe, including nucleosynthesis and the cosmic microwave background, the inflationary model for the origins of cosmic structure, and the growth of that structure through time.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, and PHYS�401; pre- or corequisite, PHYS�421.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR505
classes.subtitle: Physics of Interstellar Gas.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Surveys the physical processes governing the interstellar medium (ISM), which takes up the "refuse" of old stars while providing fuel for young stars forming. Covers the processes regulating the galactic gas budget and the corresponding observational diagnostics. Topics: radiative transfer, line formation mechanisms, continuum radiation, gas dynamics, star formation.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, MATH�383, and PHYS�331.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR519
classes.subtitle: Observational Astronomy.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Surveys the physical processes governing the interstellar medium (ISM), which takes up the "refuse" of old stars while providing fuel for young stars forming. Covers the processes regulating the galactic gas budget and the corresponding observational diagnostics. Topics: radiative transfer, line formation mechanisms, continuum radiation, gas dynamics, star formation.Requisites: Prerequisites, ASTR�202 or ASTR�301, MATH�383, and PHYS�331.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR519
classes.subtitle: Observational Astronomy.  4 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern techniques in observational astronomy with an emphasis on optical and near-infrared wavelengths.  Topics covered include celestial coordinates, practical python for astronomy, telescopes and CCDs, spectroscopy, astrostatistics, and mining large astronomical surveys. Three lecture and three laboratory hours a week.Requisites: Prerequisite, ASTR�102 or 202; Pre- or corequisite, PHYS�331; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR701
classes.subtitle: Stellar Interiors, Evolution, and Populations.  3 Credits.
classes.description: An introduction to modern techniques in observational astronomy with an emphasis on optical and near-infrared wavelengths.  Topics covered include celestial coordinates, practical python for astronomy, telescopes and CCDs, spectroscopy, astrostatistics, and mining large astronomical surveys. Three lecture and three laboratory hours a week.Requisites: Prerequisite, ASTR�102 or 202; Pre- or corequisite, PHYS�331; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR701
classes.subtitle: Stellar Interiors, Evolution, and Populations.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Stellar structure and evolution, including equations of stellar structure, stellar models, star and planet formation, fusion and nucleosynthesis, stellar evolution, stellar remnants, and the comparison of theory to observations.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR702
classes.subtitle: High Energy Astrophysics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Stellar structure and evolution, including equations of stellar structure, stellar models, star and planet formation, fusion and nucleosynthesis, stellar evolution, stellar remnants, and the comparison of theory to observations.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR702
classes.subtitle: High Energy Astrophysics.  3 Credits.
classes.description: White dwarfs and neutron stars: physical properties and observational manifestations. Extragalactic radio sources, relativistic jets, and supermassive black holes. Particle acceleration and radiative processes in hot plasmas. Accretion phenomena. X-ray and gamma-ray astrophysics.Requisites: Prerequisites, PHYS�711 and 721.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR703
classes.subtitle: Structure and Evolution of Galaxies.  3 Credits.
classes.description: White dwarfs and neutron stars: physical properties and observational manifestations. Extragalactic radio sources, relativistic jets, and supermassive black holes. Particle acceleration and radiative processes in hot plasmas. Accretion phenomena. X-ray and gamma-ray astrophysics.Requisites: Prerequisites, PHYS�711 and 721.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR703
classes.subtitle: Structure and Evolution of Galaxies.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Overview of the structure and evolution of galaxies, with emphasis on learning and applying modern research methods such as scientific literature review and computational astrostatistics. Includes galaxy morphology and dynamics, star formation, active galactic nuclei, galaxy interactions, large-scale clustering, environment-dependent physical processes, and the evolution of the galaxy population over cosmic time.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR704
classes.subtitle: Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Overview of the structure and evolution of galaxies, with emphasis on learning and applying modern research methods such as scientific literature review and computational astrostatistics. Includes galaxy morphology and dynamics, star formation, active galactic nuclei, galaxy interactions, large-scale clustering, environment-dependent physical processes, and the evolution of the galaxy population over cosmic time.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR704
classes.subtitle: Cosmology.  3 Credits.
classes.description: General relativity and cosmological world models; thermal history of the early universe, nucleosynthesis, and the cosmic microwave background; growth of structure through cosmic time.Requisites: Co-requisite, PHYS�701.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR705
classes.subtitle: Physics of Interstellar Gas.  3 Credits.
classes.description: General relativity and cosmological world models; thermal history of the early universe, nucleosynthesis, and the cosmic microwave background; growth of structure through cosmic time.Requisites: Co-requisite, PHYS�701.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR705
classes.subtitle: Physics of Interstellar Gas.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Surveys the physical processes governing the interstellar medium (ISM), which takes up the "refuse" of old stars while providing fuel for young stars forming. Covers the processes regulating the galactic gas budget and the corresponding observational diagnostics. Topics: radiative transfer, line formation mechanisms, continuum radiation, gas dynamics, star formation.Requisites: Prerequisites, PHYS�711 and 721.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR719
classes.subtitle: Astronomical Data.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Surveys the physical processes governing the interstellar medium (ISM), which takes up the "refuse" of old stars while providing fuel for young stars forming. Covers the processes regulating the galactic gas budget and the corresponding observational diagnostics. Topics: radiative transfer, line formation mechanisms, continuum radiation, gas dynamics, star formation.Requisites: Prerequisites, PHYS�711 and 721.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR719
classes.subtitle: Astronomical Data.  4 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, physics-based cosmology course or permission of the instructor. A course designed to familiarize the student with observational techniques in optical and radio astronomy, including application of photography, spectroscopy, photometry, and radio methods. Three lecture and three laboratory hours a week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR891
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Astrophysics.  1-21 Credits.
classes.description: Required preparation, physics-based cosmology course or permission of the instructor. A course designed to familiarize the student with observational techniques in optical and radio astronomy, including application of photography, spectroscopy, photometry, and radio methods. Three lecture and three laboratory hours a week.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: ASTR891
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Astrophysics.  1-21 Credits.
classes.description: Recent observational and theoretical developments in stellar, galactic, and extragalactic astrophysics.Grading status: Letter grade.
